ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How important is it to you to always have an ongoing romantic relationship?
Notes: 1 = Not important at all; 7 = Extremely important

ElementDescription: To what degree do you need other people in order to feel okay about yourself?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 7 = To an extreme degree

ElementDescription: How important is it to you to receive positive comments from the people you feel close to?
Notes: 1 = Not important at all; 7 = Extremely important

ElementDescription: Do you often fear being rejected by those you love?
Notes: 1 = Never; 7 = All the time

ElementDescription: Do you often fear being criticized by those you love?
Notes: 1 = Never; 7 = All the time

ElementDescription: To what degree do you depend on the people you feel close to for meeting your needs?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 7 = To an extreme degree

ElementDescription: How hard do you try to fulfill the needs of the people you feel close to?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 7 = Extremely hard

ElementDescription: Do you feel resentful when you do not get your way with the people you feel close to?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 7 = Extremely resentful

ElementDescription: To what degree will you go out of your way to preserve friendships?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 7 = To an extreme degree

ElementDescription: How important is it for you to always be accepted by your friends?
Notes: 1 = Not important at all; 7 = Extremely important

ElementDescription: To what degree does it hurt when you feel criticized by someone you feel close to?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 7 = To an extreme degree

ElementDescription: Do you often find yourself giving in to the wishes of others?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 7 = Extremely often

ElementDescription: To what degree do you go along with others so they will still like you?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 7 = To an extreme degree

ElementDescription: In general, how sincere are the people you feel close to?
Notes: 1 = Not at all sincere; 7 = Extremely sincere

ElementDescription: How sincere are the people you feel close to when they tell you how they feel about you?
Notes: 1 = Not at all sincere; 7 = Extremely sincere

ElementDescription: Do you often wonder whether people you feel close to are sincere when they compliment you?
Notes: 1 = Do not wonder at all; 7 = Wonder all the time

ElementDescription: Do you often think that people you feel close to may not truly care about you even when they say they do?
Notes: 1 = Never think so; 7 = Always think so

ElementDescription: To what degree are you dependent on the people you feel close to?
Notes: 1 = Not at all dependent; 7 = Extremely dependent

ElementDescription: Do you feel worthless without the approval of others?
Notes: 1 = Definitely do not feel worthless without the approval of others; 7 = Definitely feel worthless without the approval of others

ElementDescription: Do you find yourself often asking the people you feel close to how they truly feel about you?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 7 = Extremely often

ElementDescription: Do you frequently seek reassurance from the people you feel close to as to whether they really care about you?
Notes: 1 = No, Not at All; 2=No, Hardly Ever; 3=Not Really; 4=I'm Not Sure; 5= Yes, Somewhat; 6=Yes, Quite Often; 7=Yes, Very Much

ElementDescription: Do the people you feel close to sometimes get "fed up" with you for seeking reassurance from them about whether they really care about you?
Notes: 1 = No, Not at All; 2=No, Hardly Ever; 3=Not Really; 4=I'm Not Sure; 5= Yes, Somewhat; 6=Yes, Quite Often; 7=Yes, Very Much

ElementDescription: When it comes to the people you feel close to, how certain are you that they really care about you?
Notes: 1 = No, Not at All; 2=No, Hardly Ever; 3=Not Really; 4=I'm Not Sure; 5= Yes, Somewhat; 6=Yes, Quite Often; 7=Yes, Very Much

ElementDescription: Do the people you feel close to sometimes become irritated with you for seeking reassurance from them about whether they really care about you?
Notes: 1 = No, Not at All; 2=No, Hardly Ever; 3=Not Really; 4=I'm Not Sure; 5= Yes, Somewhat; 6=Yes, Quite Often; 7=Yes, Very Much

ElementDescription: After you've asked the people you feel close to how they feel about you and they've said that they have positive feelings for you, do you continue to ask them how they feel about you?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 7 = Extremely often

ElementDescription: After you've asked for and received reassurance from the people you feel close to, how soon thereafter do you feel a need to ask for more reassurance about their feelings for you?
Notes: 1 = Not soon at all; 7 = Right away

ElementDescription: DIRI Factor 1: General Dependency Mean
DIRI Factor 2: Doubt in Others' Sincerity Mean
Excessive Reassurance Seeking Total Mean Score
Notes: Higher score indicates greater reassurance-seeking

ElementDescription: DIRI Factor 4: Dependence on Close Others Mean
